meanings.definition: The art of interpreting music through bodily movement.
meanings.sent1: She performed graceful eurythmies to the music at the recital.
meanings.sent2: The dance instructor taught the students eurythmies to express the music.
meanings.sent3: During the talent show, his eurythmies were so entertaining that everyone clapped.
meanings.sent4: Her eurythmies were like a beautiful painting brought to life by the music.
meanings.sent5: The eurythmies of the ballet dancers left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The practice of rhythmic body movements as a form of physical education.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed the eurythmies class where they danced to the beat.
meanings.sent2: Eurythmies can help improve coordination and flexibility in individuals.
meanings.sent3: The eurythmies session was so fun that even the teachers joined in.
meanings.sent4: In the gym, the eurythmies of the students resembled a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The eurythmies routine was a great way to start the morning with energy.

meanings.definition: The harmonious arrangement of bodily movements in response to music.
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved in perfect eurythmies with the melody of the song.
meanings.sent2: Eurythmies involve coordinating your body movements with the rhythm.
meanings.sent3: His eurythmies were so precise that it looked like a choreographed routine.
meanings.sent4: The eurythmies of the performers were like a visual symphony to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The eurythmies of the group were so synchronized, it was mesmerizing to watch.
